title.narrative: Tanzania Country Programme Health Sector Support

description.narrative: The objective of the Health Sector Program Support phase V is to improve the health and well-being of the poorest sections of the Tanzanian society by strengthening national systems to enhance the delivery of equal access to quality health services for all.

Impact Indicators: Maternal mortality rate (2015: 432 pr. 100.000 live births - 2020: 292 pr. 100.000 live births ; Share of health in total government budget (2014: 8,1% - 2019: 15%); Neonatal mortality rate (2015: 26 pr. 1000 live births - 2020: 16 pr. 1000 live births); Infant mortality rate (2015: 45 pr. 1000 live births - 2020: 35 pr. 1000 live births) and under 5 mortality rate (2015: 81 pr. 1000 live births - 2020: 55 pr. 1000 live births); Children under five who are underweight (2015: 16% - 2020: 11%); Children under five who are stunted (2015: 42% - 2020: 27%); Rate of vaccination of children under 5.
Outcome Indicators: Percentage of women of reproductive age (15-49 years) using modern family planning methods (2014: 27% - 2019: 60%); Percentage of PHC facilities with continuous availability of 10 tracer medicines (medicines, vaccines, medical devices) in the past year (2014: 31% - 2019: 55%); Percentage of primary health facilities with 3 stars rating or higher (2014: 15% - 2019: 50%)
